messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] sitting and learning
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/25/2002 10:46:24 AM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Good idea, Mary! He does have a notebook that he keeps in his room. I see him writing in it
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/25/2002 10:46:24 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
zenmomma@... writes:


> Maybe he'd like journals or sketchbooks to write down observations, ideas,
> stories, doodles, etc. Casey likes to observe and document almost
> everything, even TV shows.

Good idea, Mary! He does have a notebook that he keeps in his room. I see him
writing in it often, I imagine it's a journal of some sort.

Take care,
Dena


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: sitting and learning
messages.msgSnippet: ... Maybe he d like journals or sketchbooks to write down observations, ideas, stories, doodles, etc. Casey likes to observe and document almost everything,
messages.messageBody:
>>I just wanted to comment that my son (8 yo) thinks he needs to be sitting
>>down and writing something to be learning.>>

Maybe he'd like journals or sketchbooks to write down observations, ideas,
stories, doodles, etc. Casey likes to observe and document almost
everything, even TV shows.

Life is good.
~Mary
